#Text=Nanda Devi National Park
#Text=Nanda Devi National Park is in Garhwal , northern India .
#Text=It is named after the highest mountain entirely in India and has been inscribed on the UNESCO World Heritage list .
#Text=Landscape and people
#Text=The landscape is dominated by mountains .
#Text=The park contains or is delimited by 24 peaks at least 6,000 m above the sea level .
#Text=Nanda Devi is 7,816 m high .
#Text=The area is inhabited by the indigenous Bhotiya tribal community .
#Text=There are 22 villages in the Niti Valley region on the periphery of the park .
#Text=A majority of the villages practice trancehumance , i.e. they will live for six months in the upper villages , and move down to winter villages to avoid the extreme climate .
#Text=Bhotiyas are a closely knit society and still practice their traditional customs and rituals .
#Text=Village Lata is famous for its week-long Mask Dance festival observed during the second week of April every year .
#Text=There are places of archaeological interest in the Niti Valley , and a 12th-century temple of Nanda Devi in the village of Lata .
#Text=The native Bhotiya community was in the forefront of Chipko Movement during the 1970s .
#Text=The prompt action taken by Gaura Devi and few other village women is a milestone in the non-violent struggle of tribal communities in saving their forest wealth .
#Text=The political leadership in Niti Valley Painkhanda region was provided by Comrade Govind Singh Rawat .
#Text=Flora and fauna
#Text=Wildlife in the park includes snow leopards , black and brown bears , tahrs , deer , musk deer and monkeys .
#Text=Over 100 species of birds and 312 floral species have been documented .
#Text=Get in
#Text=The closest cities are Joshimath northwest of the park and Munsyari southeast of the park .
#Text=The best access route is via Haridwar , from where you drive to Rishikesh , Srinagar , Rudraprayag , Karnprayag , Chamoli and Joshimath .
#Text=Village Lata , the gateway to the Nanda Devi National Park , is 25 km upstream from Joshimath on Niti-Malari highway .
#Text=Another route is from Kathgodam from Kumaon side .
#Text=The route from Kathgodam covers Almora , Kausani , Baijnath , Gwaldam and meets at Karnprayag .
#Text=The nearest airport is in Dehradun , which is 14 km from Rishikesh .
#Text=Fees and permits
#Text=The DFO Joshimath issues permits for trekking inside the park .
#Text=See

#Text=The Interpretation Center on Bio-Cultural Diversity of Niti Valley at Lata Village provides a detailed history exploration , mountaineering , Chipko and post Chipko movement and also showcases a vide range of traditional cultural artifacts .
#Text=Do

#Text=Nanda Devi National Park Interpretive Trek ( Nanda Devi Trek ) , Shepherds Lodge Devangan , Thuaa , V&P Lata , Chamoli ( 4 days of trek from Lata village ) , ☏ +918006872193 , ✉ ndi.kuflon@gmail.com .
#Text=The Nanda Devi National Park Interpretive Trek is managed by the local community .
#Text=The trek starts from the village of Lata and culminates at Suraithota .
#Text=The visitors camp at Kanook and Lata Kharak while at the village of Tolma homestay arrangements are made .
#Text=The highest elevation gained during the trek is .
#Text=Since the landscape is almost vertical , chances of AMS remains high .
#Text=The trekkers camp midway at Camp Kanook , between Lata village and Lata Kharak , to acclimatize before attempting the high altitude .
#Text=The Nanda Devi Trek is planned as an all immersive experience for travelers .
#Text=Lodging
#Text=Shepherds Lodge Devangan ( Latu Ka Lodge ) , Thuaa , Village Lata ( Drive 25 Km upstream from Joshimath on Niti Malari road ) , ☏ +919761188401 , ✉ bhotiya@gmail.com .
#Text=Check-in : noon , check-out : 11AM .
#Text=The lodge is best suited for off-road travelers who are looking for a more immersive experience with nature and culture .
#Text=It ’s also an ideal base for responsible trekkers planning to explore the bio-culture diversity and mesmerizing landscape and wilderness of the world heritage Nanda Devi National Park .
#Text=The tariff includes dinner and breakfast .
#Text=There is an equipment store for hiring trekking equipment
#Text=Stay safe
#Text=The terrain in Nanda Devi National Park is almost vertical .
#Text=Therefore , altitude sickness is definitely a risk while trekking in the park .
#Text=It is advisable to strictly follow best practices , especially an acclimatization drill , and carry enough woolens , water , emergency rations and medicine kit .
#Text=Avoid zipped itineraries that propose trekking straight to Lata Kharak in a single day .
#Text=Most of the health issues in the Nanda Devi National Park region are due to rapid altitude gain .
